page.title: 02TRANSPORT THROUGH FLADBURY.
page.content: Fladbury is mid-way between Evesham and Pershore and is bounded on the Eastern side by the River Avon. The road through the village links the Old Worcester Road,B4084,with the A44 and is the only river crossing,via Jubilee Bridge,between Evesham and Pershore.This link is frequently used as an unofficial bypass for Evesham,causing the village to have more than its fair share of traffic,some very heavy,passing through it.There is,however,occasional relief when the part of the road near Jubilee Bridge is flooded! In the whole of the County of Worcester there are only about four places which have public access to the Avon and The Wharf ,near the Mill is one of them.This access is a great asset for this riverside village.
